newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-FRENCH PLAYER BANNED FOR SMOKING CANNABIS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FRENCH PLAYER BANNED FOR SMOKING CANNABIS.

text.p: Nancy defender Jimmy Maillard, who failed a dope test after a league match against Metz last month, was given a two-month ban by the French Soccer Federation on Thursday.

Maillard admitted smoking cannabis at a party. The ban is the same as those handed to a number of players who failed tests for cannabis last season, the most famous being international goalkeeper Fabien Barthez.
